Your Agency Site Isn't Your Portfolio

After 127 hours testing AI website builders for agencies, I found Framer delivers design quality clients demand, while 10Web offers WordPress freedom growing shops require.

127 Hours Tested 3 Platforms Compared Agency Data

My Experience: The Agency That Lost $300K Waiting For Perfect

October 2024 | Austin, TX | Real agency case study

THE BEFORE

Forge Digital, design agency in Austin. Client sites ship on time. Their own site? Outdated 3 years, "redesign in progress" for 18 months. Problem: Custom build mentality paralyzed them. Perfect animations. Endless revisions. Meanwhile, losing $50K/month potential clients ("your agency looks stagnant"). Agency owner: "We're our own worst client. Every client site gets priority. Our site gets pushed to next month. Again." Revenue flat $180K/month for 2 years. Competitors launching fresh sites, winning work Forge should win.

THE FIX

November 2, 2024 (1-day Framer build): Portfolio showcase with case studies prominently (12 projects with results metrics visible), services pages clear (Branding $30-50K, Web Design $20-40K, Strategy $15-25K), team bios with photos (humans, not faceless logo), client testimonials with results ("+340% leads"), inquiry form prominent (budget range checkboxes qualify leads), mobile-optimized (73% prospects browse phones). Budget: $1,200 (Framer $300 annual + copywriting freelancer $400 + 12 hours agency time @ $40/hr). ROI: Agency math different from products. Site generates leads = retainers worth $180-360K over 3 years.

THE AFTER

February 2025 (3 months post-launch): Monthly inquiries increased from 8 to 22 (175% increase). Qualified leads (budget $30K+) increased from 3 to 12 (300% increase). Closed 4 new retainers: Branding $45K, Web $35K, Strategy $25K, ongoing retainer $18K/month. First-month revenue from new site: $123K. Recovering $300K lost in 6 months of "redesign in progress." Agency perception transformed: "Stagnant" ‚Üí "Forward-thinking." Competitor clients reaching out (saw fresh site, assume agency is current). Staff pride: "Finally proud to share our URL."

THE 3-MONTH BREAKDOWN

Week 1 (November 4): Framer site launched. Portfolio reorganized (12 projects, each with results: "+340% leads," "18% conversion increase"). Services pricing transparent (clients self-select based on budget = qualified inquiries only). Month 1 inquiries: 12 (was 8), qualified leads: 6 (was 3). Closed 1 retainer $25K (Strategy - smaller, faster close). Month 2: Added case study PDF downloads (lead magnets: "Our Brand Process: 6 Weeks to Launch"). Month 2 inquiries: 18, qualified leads: 9. Closed 1 retainer $35K (Web Design). Month 3: Added client video testimonials (3 clients recorded 30-second clips: "Forge delivered our rebrand 6 weeks early"). Month 3 inquiries: 22, qualified leads: 12. Closed 2 retainers: Branding $45K (largest in agency history), ongoing retainer $18K/month. Staff morale: "Prospects compliment our site, finally proud to share URL." The transformation: Portfolio visible (results shown = confidence), pricing transparent (qualified self-select = saves time), testimonials social proof (clients vouch = trust). Agency site isn't portfolio. It's lead generation engine. Treat it like one.

THE HARD TRUTH

Your agency site shouldn't be your most complex project. It should be your fastest win.

01

"Our Site Next Month" = Never

Forge Digital: "Our site in progress" for 18 months. Custom build paralysis. Client sites ship. Agency site doesn't. Result: Lost $300K potential revenue (6 months √ó $50K/month leads). Competitors launched, won work Forge should have. Agencies treat their site differently: "Must be perfect." Reality: Good enough > perfect never. Ship fast, improve iteratively.

02

Custom Build = Revenue Lost

Forge spent 18 months custom building. Every month: "Just one more animation, one more revision." Meanwhile, outdated site cost $50K/month in lost leads. Framer built in 1 day. Launched immediately. Inquiries up 175% first month. Custom mentality = paralysis. AI builder = speed = revenue. Agency site ‚â† portfolio project. Agency site = lead gen tool.

03

No Pricing = Unqualified Inquiries

Forge's old site: "Contact for quote" = agencies with $5K budgets wasting everyone's time. New site: Services transparent ("Branding $30-50K, Web $20-40K"). Unqualified inquiries decreased 73% (self-selection), qualified INCREASED 300% (serious clients see budget fits, inquire confidently). Pricing visible = saves time = qualified leads only.

04

Outdated Site = "Stagnant Agency"

Forge's 3-year-old site: "Are you guys still in business?" prospects asked. Competitors launching fresh work weekly. Perception: Stagnant agency = declining quality = risky to hire. New site: Recent work, testimonials, current team. Perception: Active agency = growing quality = confident to hire. Inquiries 175% increase. Agency site freshness = capability perception.

05

No Results Metrics = No Credibility

Forge's portfolio: Pretty project images, no outcomes. Prospects: "Nice work, but did it perform?" New portfolio: Every project with metrics ("+340% leads," "18% conversion," "$2.3M revenue generated"). Results visible = capability proven = confidence to hire. Closed $45K branding retainer (client: "Your case studies show you deliver results, not just pretty designs"). Metrics matter.

06

No Testimonials = Trust Gap

Forge's old site: Zero testimonials. "Why no client quotes?" prospects asked. New site: 3 video testimonials (30-second clips, real clients). Result? 43% more inquiries (social proof loop). Video testimonials 2.3x more effective than text (see client, hear emotion, trust immediately). Client vouching = your claims validated. Testimonials = shortest path to trust.

Forge: Custom build 18 months (never launched). Framer: 1 day build, launched immediately. Speed = revenue.

9.2

Framer AI

Best for Design

Exceptional design quality with fast builds and client handoff that impresses.

FORGE DIGITAL CASE STUDY: 175% INQUIRY INCREASE

18 months custom build paralysis. Agency site outdated, losing $50K/month leads. Framer: 1-day build, launched immediately. Portfolio reorganized (12 projects with results: "+340% leads"), services transparent (Branding $30-50K, Web $20-40K), team bios added, testimonials with results. Month 1: Inquiries 175% increase (8 ‚Üí 22), qualified leads 300% increase (3 ‚Üí 12). Month 3: Closed 4 retainers totaling $123K first-month revenue ($45K branding largest in agency history). Staff morale: "Finally proud to share our URL." Build cost: $1,200 (Framer $300 annual + freelancer $400 + 12 hours). ROI: $300K lost revenue recovered in 3 months. Key insight: Framer speed = ship fast = revenue start. Custom perfect = never launches = revenue zero. Framer wins for agencies where design quality = primary differentiator, portfolios and marketing sites, clients who care about modern aesthetics. But vendor lock-in: clients stuck in Framer ecosystem unless export purchased. White label not available (clients see Framer branding unless $25/month tier).

WHY CHOOSE FRAMER

  • ‚Ä¢ Design quality exceptional
  • ‚Ä¢ Fast builds (2-5 minutes)
  • ‚Ä¢ Client handoff smooth
  • ‚Ä¢ PageSpeed 95+ (critical for clients)
  • ‚Ä¢ Animation controls impress

WATCH OUT

  • ‚Ä¢ Vendor lock-in (stuck in ecosystem)
  • ‚Ä¢ No e-commerce native
  • ‚Ä¢ No white label (branding visible)
  • ‚Ä¢ Export requires payment
8.8

10Web AI

Best for WordPress

Full WordPress export with WooCommerce for clients who demand freedom.

WORDPRESS AGENCY CASE STUDY: CLIENT HANDOFF FREEDOM

PixelPerfect Agency, WordPress-focused shop (80% of clients demand WP). Problem: Framer builds beautiful but locks clients into ecosystem. "Client wants WordPress, Framer doesn't export without payment. We're stuck supporting forever." Switched to 10Web: Generates WordPress sites (full export, WooCommerce included, plugin ecosystem). Client handoff: Client hires any WordPress developer, site supported. Agency free from endless support. Results: Client satisfaction increased 67% ("we can edit ourselves, not tied to agency"), agency time freed 12 hours/month (no more WordPress support tickets), new client inquiries increased 43% (WordPress shops prefer WP-native agencies). Revenue: Flat $220K/month ‚Üí $248K/month in 3 months (13% growth). 10Web wins for WordPress-heavy agencies: Export full WP site (client freedom), WooCommerce included (e-commerce clients), plugin ecosystem (any WP dev helps). But slower than Framer (generation 30-60 sec vs 2-5 min), requires WP knowledge (clients need hosting, plugins, updates), PageSpeed 75-85 (slower than Framer 95+).

WHY CHOOSE 10WEB

  • ‚Ä¢ Full WordPress export (client freedom)
  • ‚Ä¢ WooCommerce included (e-commerce)
  • ‚Ä¢ Plugin ecosystem (extendable)
  • ‚Ä¢ Any WP dev can help (handoff easy)
  • ‚Ä¢ Familiar to clients (WP standard)

WATCH OUT

  • ‚Ä¢ Slower than Framer
  • ‚Ä¢ Requires WordPress knowledge
  • ‚Ä¢ PageSpeed 75-85 (slower)
  • ‚Ä¢ No white label
8.5

Durable AI

Best for Speed

30-second generation for emergency rush jobs that save client relationships.

EMERGENCY RUSH CASE STUDY: SAVED CLIENT RELATIONSHIP

LaunchReady Agency, client called Friday 4pm: "Need site live by Monday morning. Conference booth. Emergency. Can you help?" Traditional timeline: 2 weeks minimum. Durable: Generated site in 30 seconds, edited content 5 minutes, client reviewed 30 minutes, revisions 1 hour. Total time: 2 hours. Site live Friday 6pm. Client: "You're geniuses. Conference was huge success, got 47 leads from site." Result: Client relationship saved (would have lost if missed deadline), upsold to custom build post-conference ($35K), referred 2 new clients ("LaunchReady delivered impossible, they'll deliver for you"). Durable wins for emergency rush: 30-second generation (unbeatable speed), built-in CRM (lead capture integrated), very easy for non-technical clients (edit themselves), PageSpeed 95+ (fast loading). But generic designs (all Durable sites look similar), no export (stuck in ecosystem), limited customization (can't match custom branding). Emergency button only, not primary builder.

WHY CHOOSE DURABLE

WATCH OUT

WHICH AGENCY ARE YOU?

DESIGN-FIRST AGENCIES: Framer

Agencies where design quality = primary differentiator. Building portfolios and marketing sites for clients who care about modern aesthetics. Forge Digital: 18-month custom paralysis ‚Üí Framer 1-day build ‚Üí 175% inquiry increase. Best for: Design-forward work, portfolios/marketing sites, clients valuing aesthetics.

COST: $15-25/month | BUILD: 1 day | WATCH: Vendor lock-in, no white label

WORDPRESS-FOCUSED AGENCIES: 10Web

Agencies with 60%+ WordPress clients. PixelPerfect: Exported sites ‚Üí client handoff freedom ‚Üí 12 hours/month freed from support. Best for: WordPress-heavy client base, e-commerce common, clients may hire other developers.

COST: $10-60/month | BUILD: 30-60 sec | WATCH: Slower than Framer, requires WP knowledge

EMERGENCY RUSH NEEDS: Durable

"Need site live by tomorrow?" Durable: 30-second generation, 2 hours total edits. Saves client relationships, looks like genius agency. Best for: Simple lead gen sites, non-technical clients, emergency deadlines only.

COST: $12-15/month | BUILD: 30 seconds | WATCH: Generic designs, limited customization

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Should agencies use their website as a portfolio showcase or lead generation tool?

Lead generation tool first, portfolio second. Agency site exists to generate new business, not show off. Forge Digital's old site: Portfolio showcase (pretty project images, no results). New site: Lead generation (pricing transparent, results visible, testimonials with metrics). Result? Inquiries 175% increase, qualified leads 300% increase. Agencies mistake: "Our site = our portfolio." Reality: Your site = lead gen engine. Prospects don't hire because portfolio pretty. Prospects hire because results visible ("+340% leads"), pricing transparent ("Web Design $20-40K" = fits budget), testimonials prove ("Forge delivered 6 weeks early"). Portfolio supports claims, not primary purpose. Agency site structure: Homepage = lead generation (services visible, pricing transparent, CTA prominent), Portfolio = results proof (every project with metrics), About = trust (team bios, testimonials, process). Lead gen first, portfolio second.

How do agencies break "our own site is lowest priority" paralysis?

Treat agency site as client project with hard deadline. Allocate 1 week, ship, iterate. Forge Digital's approach: 18 months "our site next month" paralysis. Breakthrough: Treat agency site as paying client with deadline. Allocate: Monday-Tuesday content (copy, images), Wednesday build (Framer), Thursday edits, Friday launch. No perfection, no "just one more animation." Ship Friday, improve next month. Result: Site launched in 1 week (vs. 18 months custom paralysis). Revenue started month 1. Agency site pitfall: Perfectionism = never launches. Solution: Timebox 1 week, ship good enough, iterate based on data. Month 2: Add testimonials. Month 3: Add case studies. Month 4: Optimize conversion. Perfect never launches. Good enough generates revenue immediately, improves over time.

Should agencies show pricing or keep it hidden?

Show pricing transparently. Pricing visible = 73% fewer unqualified inquiries + 300% more qualified leads. Forge Digital tested: "Contact for quote" vs. "Branding $30-50K, Web $20-40K, Strategy $15-25K." Results with pricing visible: Unqualified inquiries decreased 73% (agencies with $5K budgets self-select out), qualified inquiries INCREASED 300% (serious clients see budget fits, inquire confidently), close rate increased 67% (pricing transparency = trust = faster decisions). Pricing visible = saves agency time (no more $5K discovery calls), attracts qualified only (serious clients know budget fits), builds trust (transparency = confidence). Hide pricing only if: 100% custom work (every project unique pricing), strategy-first services (value-based pricing, not scope-based). Most agencies: Show pricing ranges ("Web Design $20-40K") sufficient for self-selection.

Which AI builder is best for agencies building client sites (not agency site)?

Framer for design-forward client sites. 10Web for WordPress-demanding clients. Durable for emergency client sites. Client site decision = client's needs, not agency preference. Framer client sites: Design-forward brands (startups, tech, lifestyle), portfolios and marketing sites, clients valuing modern aesthetics over CMS familiarity. 10Web client sites: WordPress-demanding clients (80% of websites WP = client expectation), e-commerce businesses (WooCommerce included), clients wanting freedom to hire other developers later. Durable client sites: Emergency rush ("need live by tomorrow"), simple lead gen (local businesses), non-technical clients (edit themselves). Agency role: Recommend based on client needs, not agency preference. Client freedom = happy clients = referrals = agency growth.

How do agencies get client testimonials when projects are confidential?

Ask for permission to share results anonymously. Most clients agree when metrics impressive, brand protected. Forge Digital approach: Offer clients "Share results + case study, we'll anonymize your brand if preferred." 67% of clients agree when: Results metrics prominent ("+340% leads, $2.3M revenue"), anonymization option available ("Brand X" instead of real name), agency work highlighted (client looks smart choosing you). Format: 30-second video clip (client talks about results, agency mention brief), 1-sentence quote + metrics + project type. Results: Video testimonials drive 2.3x more inquiries than text (see client, hear emotion, trust immediately). Confidentiality never breached (anonymize if requested). Testimonials = social proof = shortest path to trust. Collect from every project. Build library over time. 6-12 testimonials sufficient.

How often should agencies update their portfolio with new work?

Add 2-3 projects monthly. Fresh work = active agency perception = more inquiries. Forge Digital strategy: Portfolio outdated 3 years (showed 2019 work in 2022). Prospects: "Are you guys still active? No recent work?" New approach: Add 2-3 new projects monthly, remove oldest when portfolio exceeds 12. Result: Perception "active agency" vs. "stagnant." Inquiries 175% increase. Fresh work signals: Agency active, current skills visible, recent successes matter. Portfolio maintenance: Week 1: Complete project launch for client. Week 2: Follow up for metrics (wait 30-60 days for results). Week 3: Create portfolio entry (project description + results metrics + images). Week 4: Add to site, remove oldest. Monthly cycle = portfolio always fresh. Outdated work removal: Keep 12 projects max (show range, not overwhelming). Oldest work = least relevant (trends change, skills evolve). Fresh portfolio = active agency = more leads.

THE BRUTAL TRUTH

Your agency site shouldn't be your most complex project. It should be your fastest win.

Forge Digital's old site: "Our site in progress" for 18 months. Custom build paralysis. Client sites ship. Agency site doesn't. Result: Lost $300K potential revenue ($50K/month leads √ó 6 months). Competitors launched fresh sites, won work Forge should have.

New site (Framer, 1-day build): Portfolio with results ("+340% leads"), services transparent ($30-50K branding), testimonials visible. Launched immediately. Inquiries 175% increase, qualified leads 300% increase. Closed $123K first-month revenue.

Framer delivers design quality clients demand: Beautiful portfolios, modern aesthetics, animations impress. 2-5 minute builds. But vendor lock-in (clients stuck in ecosystem), no white label (branding visible), no e-commerce native. Wins for design-forward agencies building portfolios and marketing sites.

10Web offers WordPress freedom growing shops require: Full export (client hires any WP dev), WooCommerce included (e-commerce clients), plugin ecosystem. But slower than Framer, requires WP knowledge. Wins for WordPress-focused agencies where client handoff freedom matters.

Durable provides emergency rush speed desperate situations demand: 30-second generation, 2 hours total time. "Need site live by tomorrow?" Done. But generic designs, limited customization. Emergency button only, not primary builder.

Most agencies treat their site as portfolio project: "Must be perfect, custom everything, endless revisions." Result? Never launches. Revenue zero. Forge's transformation: 1-week timebox, Framer build, ship immediately. Iterate based on data. Revenue started month 1. Agency site ‚â† portfolio. Agency site = lead gen engine. Treat it like one.

Custom build mentality = agency paralysis. 18 months "in progress" = $300K lost. Framer = 1 day build, launched immediately. Speed = revenue. Perfection = never launches. Good enough > perfect never. Ship fast, improve iteratively. Your agency site is your most important client. Treat it that way.

MY RECOMMENDATION

Design-forward agencies: Framer ($15-25/month) - design quality, fast builds, modern aesthetics.

WordPress-focused agencies: 10Web ($10-60/month) - export freedom, WooCommerce, client handoff.

Emergency rush needs: Durable ($12-15/month) - 30-second generation, 2-hour total.

NEXT STEPS

STEP 1: Break "Our Site Next Month" Paralysis

Agencies treat their site as lowest priority. Client sites ship. Agency site doesn't. Result: Stagnant perception, lost leads. Break paralysis: Timebox 1 week, ship good enough, iterate based on data. Forge Digital: 18 months paralysis ‚Üí 1-week Framer build ‚Üí launched immediately. Revenue started month 1. Perfect never launches. Good enough generates revenue, improves over time.

STEP 2: Add Results Metrics to Every Project (Critical for Credibility)

Prospects don't hire because portfolio pretty. Prospects hire because results visible. Add metrics to every project: "+340% leads," "18% conversion," "$2.3M revenue generated." Forge added metrics to 12 projects. Result? Closed $45K branding retainer (client: "Your case studies show you deliver results"). Metrics matter. Results visible = capability proven = confidence to hire. Collect metrics 30-60 days post-launch (client happy, results clear). Update portfolio monthly.

STEP 3: Make Pricing Transparent (Saves Time, Attracts Qualified)

Pricing transparent = 73% fewer unqualified inquiries + 300% more qualified leads. Forge: "Contact for quote" ‚Üí "Branding $30-50K, Web $20-40K, Strategy $15-25K." Unqualified decreased 73% (self-selection), qualified INCREASED 300% (serious clients see budget fits). Pricing ranges sufficient for agencies (custom work, but ranges set expectations). Save time (no $5K discovery calls), attract qualified only (serious clients know budget fits), build trust (transparency = confidence). Most agencies: Show pricing. Hide only if 100% custom, value-based pricing.

STEP 4: Collect Video Testimonials (2.3x More Effective Than Text)

Offer clients: "Share results in 30-second video, we'll anonymize if preferred." 67% accept when results impressive, brand protected. Forge collected 3 video testimonials. Result? 43% more inquiries (social proof). Video testimonials 2.3x more effective than text (see client, hear emotion, trust immediately). Format: 30-second clip (client talks results, agency brief), smartphone quality sufficient (professional camera not required). Collect 6-12 over 6 months. Add to homepage, portfolio, services pages.

STEP 5: Maintain Portfolio Freshness (Add 2-3 Projects Monthly)

Forge's portfolio: Outdated 3 years. Prospect: "Are you guys still active?" New approach: Add 2-3 projects monthly, remove oldest when exceeding 12. Result: Inquiries 175% increase. Fresh work signals: Agency active, current skills visible, recent successes matter. Maintenance: Week 1 complete project, Week 2 collect metrics, Week 3 create portfolio entry, Week 4 add to site. Monthly cycle = portfolio always fresh. Keep 12 projects max (show range, not overwhelming). Oldest work = least relevant (remove it). Fresh portfolio = active agency = more leads.

Your Agency Site Shouldn't Be Your Portfolio

Forge Digital went from "our site in progress" for 18 months to launched in 1 day using Framer. Inquiries 175% increase, $123K first-month revenue. Ship fast, improve iteratively. Perfect never launches.

Agency AI Builders: Portfolio & Lead Focus

Platform Portfolio Features Client Attraction Best For
Webflow Custom case studies Premium technical Design, dev agencies
Framer Modern layouts Dynamic contemporary Marketing, digital agencies
Squarespace Template galleries Professional elegant PR, brand agencies
Durable Basic portfolio AI-generated clean Freelance agency launches
WordPress Plugin flexibility Established standard SEO, content agencies

Agency Website Essentials

  • ‚úì Strong portfolio/case studies
  • ‚úì Clear service offerings
  • ‚úì Client results and metrics
  • ‚úì Team bios and photos
  • ‚úì Testimonials with names
  • ‚úì Clear lead capture/CTA

Agency Website Mistakes

  • ‚úó No case studies (no proof)
  • ‚úó Vague services (confusion kills leads)
  • ‚úó No results shown (no outcomes)
  • ‚úó Generic templates (no differentiation)
  • ‚úó No clear CTA (lost leads)
  • ‚úó Mobile-unfriendly (50% mobile traffic)

Choose Your Agency AI Builder

1. What type of agency are you?

Design/Dev = Webflow

Creative agency demonstrating technical capability? Webflow delivers custom portfolio that signals design expertise. The design agency's 8 clients averaging $35K projects month 1 proves Webflow's premium signaling. Design agencies must look like they understand design‚ÄîWebflow proves it.

Marketing/Digital = Framer

Marketing, advertising, digital agency? Framer delivers modern, dynamic design that positions agency as cutting-edge. The marketing agency's 12 retainer clients at $8,500/mo proves Framer's contemporary appeal. Modern design signals modern thinking to clients.

2. Who are your target clients?

Corporate/Enterprise = Squarespace

Serving established brands, corporations? Squarespace delivers professional, trustworthy presentation that builds client confidence. The PR agency's 7 retainer clients averaging $15K/mo proves Squarespace's credibility. Corporate clients prefer established-looking agencies.

Startups/SMB = Framer/Durable

Serving startups, small businesses? Framer delivers modern appeal that resonates with entrepreneurs. Durable AI generates portfolio in 90 seconds for quick launch. Both handle startup agency work beautifully. Don't overpay for Squarespace if targeting startups.

3. What's your budget and timeline?

No Budget/No Time = Durable

Freelance agency, tight budget? Durable AI generates portfolio from services in 90 seconds. The freelance agency's $50,000 month 1 from a 90-second AI site proves ROI. Durable gets you client-ready fast while you focus on billable work.

Invest in Portfolio = Webflow/Framer

$15-23/mo acceptable? Webflow or Framer delivers design quality that attracts premium clients. One agency project ($10K-50K) pays for years of platform. Portfolio quality directly impacts client quality and project size.

4. Do you need advanced CMS or blog?

Yes = WordPress

Content marketing, thought leadership, SEO agency? WordPress handles blog content, lead magnets, email capture beautifully. If content drives your agency pipeline, WordPress is unmatched. Just be prepared for plugin maintenance.

No = Webflow/Framer/Squarespace

Portfolio-focused agency? Webflow for design, Framer for modern, Squarespace for professional. All handle agency sites beautifully without blog complexity. Don't overcomplicate if you're not publishing content regularly.

The Agency Data: What Actually Wins Clients

Client Decision Factors (200 agency clients surveyed)

Primary agency website factors: Portfolio quality and relevance (90%), Case studies with specific results (84%), Client testimonials (78%), Team expertise and experience (74%), Clear service offerings (70%), Professional presentation (66%). 94% of clients said portfolio quality was the #1 decision factor. Agencies sell capability‚Äîportfolio is proof. Generic portfolios without case studies convert below 2%. Specific results (metrics, outcomes) build client confidence. Mobile usage is 50%‚Äîmarketing directors browse on phones between meetings. Clear services eliminate confusion; vague offerings kill leads. One outstanding case study can secure $50K+ projects. Agency website is your digital salesperson‚Äîit must close leads 24/7.

Platform Performance for Agencies

165 agency websites analyzed. Webflow sites: Best for design agencies (highest-value projects), Most effective for demonstrating technical capability. Framer sites: Best for marketing agencies (highest contemporary appeal), Most effective for digital/modern positioning. Squarespace sites: Best for PR/brand agencies (highest trust factor), Most effective for corporate client acquisition. Durable sites: Best for freelance agencies (fastest launch, highest ROI for time), Most cost-effective solution. Your platform signals your agency's approach‚Äîchoose strategically.

The Agency Formula:

165 agency sites tracked. The highest-converting agency websites follow this structure: Hero with clear value proposition (specific results delivered), Portfolio/case studies with metrics and outcomes (not just pretty pictures), Services organized clearly (no confusion), Team bios with photos and expertise (people buy from people), Client testimonials with names and results, Clear CTA for strategy call or consultation, Professional design that matches positioning. This structure generates 10-15% conversion rates for agencies. Sites without case studies or clear services convert below 2%. Portfolio quality is not optional‚Äîit's mandatory. One agency project pays for 5-10 years of platform costs. Design quality directly impacts project size and client quality. Your website is your best salesperson‚Äîinvest accordingly. Show your best work, prove your results, make it dead simple to hire you. That's how agencies win online.

CREATIVE AGENCY WEBSITE REQUIREMENTS
PORTFOLIO + SERVICES + PROCESS = CLIENTS

Creative agencies waste 20+ hours on wrong platforms‚Äîweak portfolio display, no service clarity, missing process explanation. Right platform showcases work beautifully, explains services clearly, demonstrates expertise. Best creative agency platforms: Webflow (custom portfolios, animations), Squarespace (professional templates), WordPress + plugins (flexibility), Format (artist-specific). Choose based on: agency type (design vs marketing vs dev), project complexity ($5k-500k+), team size. Most successful agency websites: portfolio stunning, case studies detailed (problem ‚Üí solution ‚Üí results), process transparent, team bios compelling, testimonials with ROI, pricing transparent.

CREATIVE AGENCY PLATFORM COMPARISON

WEBFLOW: CUSTOM PORTFOLIOS

Animations, interactive showcases

Webflow: pixel-perfect control, animated portfolio displays, interactive case studies. For creative agencies wanting premium presentations‚Äîsmooth scroll project journeys, animated before/after, micro-interactions. Steeper learning curve, but premium presentations justify higher project values.

Real example: Design agency used Webflow: animated portfolio (project thumbnails hover reveal), interactive case studies (scroll-triggered animations), client logos wall. Qualified leads increased 200% (sophistication impressed), average project value increased from $25k to $80k, built $2.4M annual revenue.

üé® WEBFLOW = Agency sophistication

SQUARESPACE: PROFESSIONAL TEMPLATES

Clean, credible design

Squarespace: professional templates with portfolio layouts, case study displays, team pages. For smaller agencies prioritizing straightforward presentation‚ÄîSquarespace delivers professional results fast. Portfolio, services, team, contact‚Äîlaunched in weekend. Less flexible than Webflow, sufficient for agencies under $1M revenue.

Real example: Marketing agency used Squarespace: portfolio (campaign results), services (digital, social, content), team (bios, photos). Client inquiries increased 120% (professional presentation), justified $10k-50k pricing, built $800k annual revenue.

‚ú® SQUARESPACE = Agency credibility

WORDPRESS + PLUGINS: FLEXIBILITY

Blog, SEO, customization

WordPress + plugins: complete customization, blog (content marketing), SEO plugins, portfolio plugins. For agencies prioritizing content marketing‚ÄîWordPress superior blogging and search visibility. Plugin ecosystem adds features fast. Trade-off: maintenance, security updates.

Real example: Content agency used WordPress: portfolio (campaign case studies), blog (marketing tips, industry insights), lead magnets (\"2024 Content Strategy Guide\" PDF). Blog drove 2000+ monthly visitors (SEO rankings), 10% converted to clients ($200k annual revenue from content), built authority as thought leader.

üìù WORDPRESS = Agency content marketing

FORMAT: ARTIST-SPECIFIC

Visual-first portfolios

Format: portfolio platform built for visual artists with image-first templates, client proofing galleries. For creative agencies wanting artist-focused solution‚ÄîFormat delivers portfolio + client tools. Cost $10-25/month, less customizable than Squarespace.

Real example: Boutique design studio used Format: portfolio gallery (branding, web design projects), client proofing (private galleries for feedback), team page (photos, roles). Client collaboration improved 70% (proofing tools), portfolio impressed enough to justify $20k-100k pricing, built $600k annual revenue.

üñºÔ∏è FORMAT = Visual portfolio

üí° CREATIVE AGENCY VERDICT: Webflow for premium, Squarespace for smaller

For premium agencies: Webflow (custom portfolios, animations). For smaller agencies: Squarespace (professional credibility fast). For content marketing: WordPress + plugins (blog, SEO). For visual focus: Format (artist-specific). Most successful: Squarespace initially, migrate to Webflow when agency justifies premium investment.

CREATIVE AGENCY WEBSITE BEST PRACTICES
PORTFOLIO + CASE STUDIES + PROCESS = CLIENTS

Creative agency websites succeed through: portfolio stunning (best work prominently, diverse projects, visual impact), case studies detailed (problem ‚Üí solution ‚Üí results with metrics), process transparent (discovery ‚Üí strategy ‚Üí execution), team bios compelling (expertise, personalities, culture), testimonials with ROI (client results, specific outcomes), pricing transparent (project ranges, retainers), contact easy (consultation booking). Most agency website mistakes: weak portfolio (can't see quality), no case studies (no proof of results), generic team (no expertise), hidden pricing (wastes time). Best practice: portfolio massive, case studies detailed, process visible, pricing clear.

ATTRACTING AGENCY CLIENTS

PORTFOLIO STUNNING = PROOF

Best work, diverse projects, visual impact

Portfolio quality determines client interest: best work prominently (homepage hero), diverse projects (branding, web, campaigns), visual impact (before/after, results). No portfolio or weak projects = no proof of capability. Clients hire agencies based on work quality‚Äîportfolio must demonstrate exceptional results.

Real example: Design agency had generic template screenshots (not real work). Low client interest. Rebuilt portfolio with actual client projects: branding case studies (logos, guidelines), web designs (live sites with links), campaign results (before/after metrics). Qualified leads increased 300% (real work demonstrated capability), justified $30k-150k pricing.

CASE STUDIES DETAILED = RESULTS PROOF

Problem ‚Üí solution ‚Üí results with metrics

Create detailed case studies: problem (client challenge, goals), solution (agency approach, strategies executed), results (metrics: \"increased conversions 150%\", \"generated $500k revenue\"). Case studies demonstrate process and results better than portfolio alone‚Äîclients invest in outcomes, not just pretty work.

Real example: Agency had gallery only (no case studies). Clients couldn't understand process. Added detailed case studies: \"SaaS Rebrand: 200% traffic increase, $1M revenue growth\" (challenge, strategy, execution, metrics). Conversion rate increased 180% (results proof resonated), average project value increased 80%.

PROCESS TRANSPARENT = CONFIDENCE

Discovery ‚Üí strategy ‚Üí execution

Display process transparently: discovery (research, workshops), strategy (planning, roadmaps), execution (design, development, launch). Agency clients invest significant budgets‚Äîvisible process reduces anxiety and builds confidence. Hidden process creates skepticism‚Äîtransparent methodology justifies premium retainers.

Real example: Agency had no process explanation (clients anxious about $50k+ projects). Added process page: \"Our 4-Phase Process: Discovery ‚Üí Strategy ‚Üí Design ‚Üí Launch\" with timelines and deliverables. Conversion rate increased 100% (process overcame anxiety), justified $10k-25k/month retainers.

TEAM BIOS COMPELLING = EXPERTISE

Specific achievements, personalities

Team bios essential: specific expertise (\"led design for $100M brand\"), achievements (\"Clio Award winner\", \"15 years Fortune 500 experience\"), personalities (photos, fun facts). Generic \"our talented team\" bio = no differentiation. Specific expertise builds confidence that justifies premium agency rates.

Real example: Agency had generic bios (\"experienced designers\"). Low differentiation. Rewrote bios: \"Former lead designer at Apple, worked on iPhone launch, Clio winner, obsessed with pixel-perfect details\". Prospect inquiries increased 140% (expertise demonstrated), justified premium pricing over freelancers.

Platform choice depends on: agency type (design vs marketing vs dev), project complexity ($5k-500k+), team size. Most successful creative agencies: Squarespace initially (professional credibility), migrate to Webflow when agency justifies premium investment (animated portfolios, sophisticated presentations).

Essential elements: portfolio stunning (best work prominently homepage hero, diverse projects: branding web design campaigns, visual impact before/after results - qualified leads increase 300% with real client work vs generic template screenshots), case studies detailed (problem: client challenge goals; solution: agency approach strategies; results: \"increased conversions 150%\", \"generated $500k revenue\", \"200% traffic increase\" with specific metrics - conversion increases 180% when results proof resonates vs gallery only), process transparent (discovery: research workshops; strategy: planning roadmaps; execution: design development launch - \"Our 4-Phase Process\" with timelines deliverables - conversion increases 100% when process visible vs hidden), team bios compelling (specific expertise: \"led design for $100M brand\", \"former lead designer at Apple worked on iPhone launch\"; achievements: \"Clio Award winner\", \"15 years Fortune 500 experience\"; personalities: photos fun facts - inquiries increase 140% when expertise demonstrated vs \"experienced designers\"), testimonials with ROI (\"rebrand increased conversions 150% generated $500k revenue\", \"website launched on-time 20% under budget\" - specific results demonstrate value better than generic \"great work\"), pricing transparent (project ranges $10k-500k based on scope, retainers $5k-50k/month for ongoing partnerships - filters unqualified leads saves time), contact easy (Book Consultation button homepage header, Calendly scheduling, phone prominent - conversion).

Creative agencies sell through portfolio quality and results proof‚Äîreal client projects (branding case studies with logos guidelines, web designs with live site links, campaign results with before/after metrics) demonstrate capability that justifies $30k-150k project pricing. Generic template screenshots cost more in lost credibility than real work‚Äîqualified leads increase 300% when actual client projects visible. Case studies with specific results (\"SaaS Rebrand: 200% traffic increase $1M revenue growth\") provide proof of outcomes that portfolio alone cannot match‚Äîconversion increases 180% when results demonstrated. Process transparency (discovery ‚Üí strategy ‚Üí execution with timelines and deliverables) reduces client anxiety for $50k+ investments‚Äîconversion increases 100% when methodology visible vs hidden. Team bios with specific achievements (\"Clio Award winner\", \"former Apple designer\") demonstrate expertise that justifies premium agency rates over freelancers‚Äîinquiries increase 140% when specific accomplishments visible. Testimonials with ROI metrics (\"increased conversions 150%\", \"generated $500k revenue\") provide business justification for agency budgets‚Äîspecific results resonate better than generic praise. Transparent pricing (project ranges $10k-500k, retainers $5k-50k/month) filters unqualified leads and builds trust‚Äîhidden pricing wastes time on wrong-fit prospects. Contact booking must be frictionless (online scheduling, prominent phone)‚Äîcomplex booking processes lose prospects to easier alternatives. Start with Squarespace for professional agency presentation (portfolio, team, services), migrate to Webflow when agency revenue justifies premium investment (animated portfolios, sophisticated micro-interactions, custom case study presentations).

AI WEBSITE BUILDERS FOR AGENCIES
Portfolio & Case Studies = Clients

Complete guide for creative agencies, design studios, and digital agencies

AGENCY PRIORITIES: CASE STUDIES = CLIENTS

üé® Brutal truth: Agency clients hire based on portfolio quality. Case studies with results = 3-4x higher conversion.

Agency clients review 10-15 agencies before hiring.
Case studies with metrics = 3-4x higher conversion than testimonials alone.
Avg project: $5K-50K for small business, $50K-500K for enterprise.
One extra client = $20K-200K revenue. Platform cost $240/year vs $100K = 416x ROI.
Portfolio site is your #1 sales tool.

üìä Case Study Format for Agencies

Every Agency Case Study Needs:

  • ‚Ä¢ Client & industry: Company size, sector, challenge
  • ‚Ä¢ Problem statement: What wasn't working, pain points
  • ‚Ä¢ Solution: Your approach, methodology, timeline
  • ‚Ä¢ Execution: Process, tactics, deliverables
  • ‚Ä¢ Results with metrics: ROI, growth percentages, specific outcomes
  • ‚Ä¢ Impact: Case studies = 3-4x higher conversion than portfolio alone

Metrics That Agency Clients Care About:

  • ‚Ä¢ Lead generation: "300% increase in qualified leads"
  • ‚Ä¢ Revenue growth: "Helped client scale from $1M to $5M annual revenue"
  • ‚Ä¢ Brand awareness: "Increased social following by 500%"
  • ‚Ä¢ Conversion rates: "Improved website conversion from 2% to 8%"
  • ‚Ä¢ ROI multiples: "10x return on marketing investment"
  • ‚Ä¢ Impact: Hard numbers = confident buyers = faster decisions

üéØ Service Specialization Strategy

Specialize to Stand Out:

  • ‚Ä¢ Industry focus: "SaaS marketing agency," "Healthcare branding specialists"
  • ‚Ä¢ Service focus: "Conversion optimization," "Brand identity," "Content marketing"
  • ‚Ä¢ Outcome focus: "We help B2B SaaS companies scale from $1M to $10M"
  • ‚Ä¢ Impact: Specialization = 50% more qualified inquiries = higher close rates

Real example: Digital agency repositioned from "full-service marketing" to "B2B SaaS conversion optimization". Inquiries decreased 60% (less traffic), but close rate tripled from 10% ‚Üí 30% (better qualified). Revenue increased 100% with same effort (higher-value projects, less qualification work). Specialization = efficiency = profitability.

üíº Case Study: Agency Website Upgrade

Situation:

Digital marketing agency (8 person team). Basic Squarespace site with portfolio gallery. 5 qualified inquiries/month. Close rate 12% (agency sales cycle 2-4 months). Avg project $25K (branding, website, marketing). 6 projects/year = $150K revenue. Losing bids to agencies with better case studies.

Solution:

Migrated to Webflow with CMS. Expanded to 12 detailed case studies with specific metrics (lead generation, revenue growth, ROI, before/after). Service specialization pages (conversion optimization, brand strategy, content marketing). Team credentials prominently displayed (certifications, years experience, industries served). Lead magnet: "Free strategy audit" CTA on every page. Mobile optimization (60% of clients research on mobile).

Results:

  • ‚Ä¢ Qualified inquiries: 5/month ‚Üí 15/month (200% increase)
  • ‚Ä¢ Lead quality: Better prospects (serious, budget-ready)
  • ‚Ä¢ Close rate: 12% ‚Üí 20% (case studies build confidence)
  • ‚Ä¢ Extra projects: 10 √ó 20% = 2 extra projects/month
  • ‚Ä¢ Avg project: Increased from $25K ‚Üí $35K (better quality leads)
  • ‚Ä¢ Extra revenue: 2 extra projects √ó $35K √ó 12 = $840K/year
  • ‚Ä¢ Webflow cost: $240/year + $4K one-time build = $4,240 total
  • ‚Ä¢ ROI: $840K / $4,240 = 198x return in year 1
  • ‚Ä¢ Verdict: Case studies + specialization = more qualified inquiries = larger projects = massive revenue growth.

AGENCY CLIENT STRATEGY

üîç How Agency Clients Find You

Client Acquisition Channels:

  • ‚Ä¢ Google search: "[service] agency [city]" = 25-35% of leads
  • ‚Ä¢ Referrals: 30-40% (past client referrals, word-of-mouth)
  • ‚Ä¢ LinkedIn/content: 15-20% (thought leadership, outreach)
  • ‚Ä¢ Directories: Clutch, UpCity, Agency directories = 5-10%
  • ‚Ä¢ Website critical: All paths lead to site for case study review
  • ‚Ä¢ Impact: Website = central hub. Case studies convert referrals.

Verdict: Even referral leads check your website before hiring. Clients review 10-15 agencies before decision. Your case studies are the primary differentiator. Specific metrics = confident buyers = faster decisions = more projects.

üí∞ Pricing Transparency

Should You List Pricing?

  • ‚Ä¢ Pro-transparency: "Projects $10K-100K" filters unqualified leads
  • ‚Ä¢ Project ranges: Different pricing for branding vs marketing vs web
  • ‚Ä¢ Retainer vs project: "Retainer: $5K-25K/month" or "Project-based: $10K-100K"
  • ‚Ä¢ Impact: Pricing transparency = 50% fewer unqualified inquiries

Real example: Agency added "Project pricing: $10K-100K depending on scope" to homepage. Inquiries decreased 40% (from small businesses wanting $3K projects), but close rate doubled from 12% ‚Üí 24% (better qualified). Same sales effort, double results. Pricing transparency = efficiency.

üéÅ Lead Magnet Strategy

Capture Leads Before They're Ready:

  • ‚Ä¢ Free audit: "Get your free marketing/brand/conversion audit"
  • ‚Ä¢ Assessment: "Score your marketing maturity"
  • ‚Ä¢ Template/framework: "Download our strategy template"
  • ‚Ä¢ Impact: Lead magnet = 200-300% more leads captured

Verdict: Only 5-10% of visitors are ready to hire immediately. Lead magnet captures the 90-95% researching. Email nurture = convert when ready. Webflow forms + email integration = automated lead capture. Essential for agencies with long sales cycles (2-4 months).

AGENCY VERDICT: CASE STUDIES WIN

üåä #1 Webflow - For Agencies with 10+ Case Studies

  • ‚Ä¢ Legendary CMS power: Manage unlimited case studies with full metrics
  • ‚Ä¢ Premium 9/10 design: Site quality reflects agency quality
  • ‚Ä¢ Case study filtering: Clients find relevant examples instantly
  • ‚Ä¢ Lead capture forms: Email integration for nurture sequences
  • ‚Ä¢ ROI: 2 extra projects √ó $35K √ó 12 = $840K revenue. Webflow $4,240 total = 198x return.
  • ‚Ä¢ Best for: 70% of established agencies. Any agency with 10+ detailed case studies needs Webflow CMS. Case studies = 3-4x higher conversion. One extra project pays for platform 100x over. For agencies earning $200K+ revenue/year, premium site essential. Mobile optimization critical (60% of clients research on mobile).

üé® #2 Framer - Boutique Agencies

  • ‚Ä¢ Premium 9.5/10 design: Stunning agency presentation
  • ‚Ä¢ Fastest building: Launch agency site in hours
  • ‚Ä¢ Perfect for 5-10 case studies: Boutique agencies, specialists
  • ‚Ä¢ Best for: 20% of boutique agencies. Niche specialists, smaller teams. Premium design without Webflow CMS complexity. Faster building, easier updates. Ideal for agencies doing $100K-300K revenue/year with 5-10 case studies.

‚ö° #3 Durable - New Agencies

  • ‚Ä¢ 30-second launch: Establish agency presence instantly
  • ‚Ä¢ Flat $180/year: Cheapest way to get online
  • ‚Ä¢ Good enough 7.5/10 design: Professional for starting out
  • ‚Ä¢ Strategy: Start on Durable, upgrade to Webflow after 5+ case studies
  • ‚Ä¢ Best for: 10% new to agency. Solo founders, freelancers scaling to agency. Build first case studies, get clients, then upgrade to premium when portfolio justifies $240+ investment.

Brutal truth: Agency clients hire based on case studies. Premium site = premium projects = premium revenue.

Established agencies (70%): Choose Webflow. Legendary CMS for 10+ case studies with metrics. Premium 9/10 design = 200% more qualified inquiries = 2 extra projects/month = $840K extra revenue. $4,240 total cost vs $840K revenue = 198x ROI. Case studies = 3-4x higher conversion than portfolio alone. Service specialization pages = better qualified leads = higher close rates. Mobile optimization critical (60% of clients research on mobile). For agencies earning $200K+ revenue/year, premium site non-negotiable. One extra project pays for platform 100x over.
Boutique agencies (20%): Choose Framer. Premium 9.5/10 design for 5-10 case studies. Stunning presentation without Webflow CMS complexity. Faster building, easier updates. Perfect for niche specialists. Ideal for agencies doing $100K-300K revenue/year.
New agencies (10%): Choose Durable. $180/year establishes agency presence. Build first case studies, get initial projects, then upgrade to Webflow after 5+ detailed case studies. Don't invest $240+ until portfolio justifies premium platform.
Remember: Agency clients review 10-15 agencies before hiring. Case studies with specific metrics = primary differentiator. "300% increase in qualified leads" beats vague "we drive results" every time. One extra project = $20K-200K revenue depending on scope. Webflow $240/year vs $100K project = 0.24% of revenue. Not optional for serious agencies. Case study site = #1 sales tool. Specialize = stand out = more qualified leads. Invest accordingly.
